p: Dietary lipids, which are naturally occurring in raw food materials or added during food processing, serve a significant role in food industries. Lipid oxidation is the main cause of food quality deterioration; it has been a challenge for food manufacturers. Lipids may undergo oxidative processes in the presence of oxygen, moisture, light, heat, microorganisms, or the action of enzymes, leading to the loss of food wholesomeness by the deterioration of aroma and flavor, as well as the decay of nutritional value and food safety qualities (Allen & Angelo, 1992; Shahidi, 2000).
